title: Panel, 19th century
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: wax resist dyeing (batik) on plain weave
description: Oblong cotton panel in black, dark blue, cream-white, and light brown. Shows six "wayang" puppets, moving toward center shrine, bearing Rama, a god-like figure. Outer border shows "ship of the dead" design and "lar" (wing of Garuda, the mount of Vishnu) motif.

tombstone.epitaph:
Panel, 19th century. Medium: cotton
Technique: wax resist dyeing (batik) on plain weave. Gift of Alan L. Wolfe. 1962-233-5.
